front.div:
In this work, homogeneous as well as gradient a-C:H:W coatings were deposited on a steel substrate. The me-
chanical properties of both coating systems were determined using nanoindentation. In addition, a multiaxial,
3-dimensional nanoindentation test (reciprocating wear test with nanometre resolution) was carried out in
order to analyse the wear-performance of the two different coating systems.
By comparing the wear-performance of the gradient coating system to the non-graduated one we were able to
show that according to a theoretical approach proposed a few years ago the gradient coating systems lead to a
better performance in micro-wear tests as well as in macro-scale wear tests.
In addition, a new wear model taking into account the changing stress fields during the wear tests is proposed in
order to simulate the wear behaviour of both coating systems.
